issue.title: mangafire.to
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mangafire.to/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmangafire.to%2F) ### Comment > This is an issue I have been having a while, when I first found the MangaFire site it worked completely fine, no issues whatsoever. But after going from one place to another in my country, it just came up with the Safari cant establish a secure connection error. Sure, I found a solution to the problem by using a VPN to help me access it, but however there is the strangest part, whenever I use the VPN for long-period of time, it causes some after-effect that causes the site itself to be accessible, despite it not accessible, for short-period of time (note, the VPN after-effect lasted for like 5 days). But for some reason, while Im in another place that is not my home, I have this problem. > > As using the VPN helps, I always preferred to use the MangaFire site without the use of the VPN. > > Is there a way to fix this issue by using the AdGuard filters, because I have tried everything else that would help me resolve this like: clearing-up cache, etc. but none of seem to do the trick. issue.title: nytimes.com subscription banner
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.54.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances  pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.nytimes.com/2023/11/30/health/ptsd-memories-brain-trauma.html

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

Liste AR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

I keep encountering a bottom subscription banner on _New York Times_ articles. This banner says: "Enjoy unlimited access to all of The Times". 

I've used the following custom filters to get rid of them, but the webmaster keeps adding new filters, perhaps to evade detection:
```
www.nytimes.com##.css-1hyduui.shown.SUBCON__BAU_ALL_ACCESS_ACQUISITION_234
www.nytimes.com##.css-1hyduui.expanded.SUBCON__BAU_ALL_ACCESS_ACQUISITION_234
www.nytimes.com##.css-1yq8ac.expanded.CONV_DOCK_DESIGN_TEST_2311
www.nytimes.com##.css-1yq8ac.shown.CONV_DOCK_DESIGN_TEST_2311
www.nytimes.com##.css-1jc9y02.shown.CONV_DOCK_DESIGN_TEST_2311
```


<summary>Screenshot:</summary>

![Screenshot 2023-12-01 at 00-14-30 Older and Wiser Peter Gabriel Is Still Looking Ahead(1)](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/52135169/a4d519ba-e7d2-43b5-b482-3009e3624944)



### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: nytimes.com subscription banner

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.54.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances  pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.nytimes.com/2023/11/30/health/ptsd-memories-brain-trauma.html

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

Liste AR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

I keep encountering a bottom subscription banner on _New York Times_ articles. This banner says: "Enjoy unlimited access to all of The Times". 

I've used the following custom filters to get rid of them, but the webmaster keeps adding new filters, perhaps to evade detection:
```
www.nytimes.com##.css-1hyduui.shown.SUBCON__BAU_ALL_ACCESS_ACQUISITION_234
www.nytimes.com##.css-1hyduui.expanded.SUBCON__BAU_ALL_ACCESS_ACQUISITION_234
www.nytimes.com##.css-1yq8ac.expanded.CONV_DOCK_DESIGN_TEST_2311
www.nytimes.com##.css-1yq8ac.shown.CONV_DOCK_DESIGN_TEST_2311
www.nytimes.com##.css-1jc9y02.shown.CONV_DOCK_DESIGN_TEST_2311
```


<summary>Screenshot:</summary>

![Screenshot 2023-12-01 at 00-14-30 Older and Wiser Peter Gabriel Is Still Looking Ahead(1)](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/52135169/a4d519ba-e7d2-43b5-b482-3009e3624944)



### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: As I recall, the subscription banner is part of the paywall. We do not bypass it.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mangafire.to/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmangafire.to%2F) ### Comment > This is an issue I have been having a while, when I first found the MangaFire site it worked completely fine, no issues whatsoever. But after going from one place to another in my country, it just came up with the Safari cant establish a secure connection error. Sure, I found a solution to the problem by using a VPN to help me access it, but however there is the strangest part, whenever I use the VPN for long-period of time, it causes some after-effect that causes the site itself to be accessible, despite it not accessible, for short-period of time (note, the VPN after-effect lasted for like 5 days). But for some reason, while Im in another place that is not my home, I have this problem. > > As using the VPN helps, I always preferred to use the MangaFire site without the use of the VPN. > > Is there a way to fix this issue by using the AdGuard filters, because I have tried everything else that would help me resolve this like: clearing-up cache, etc. but none of seem to do the trick. Are there any specific AdGuard filters or/and DNS server that I should have enabled so this will help fix the issue. Username: `@Ian Chen` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/lbrgx6r0qi8oo4w0cos4k8og04wk0grsqe9jtb5ioo.png?nc=1)

comment.body:
The site opens fine with AdGuard filters or DNS on my end.
Perhaps your ISP blocked the access to the site for some reason. It can't be bypassed by filters.
In that case, using VPN is the best solution. You can try our AdGuard VPN with the selected mode, that will allow you to visit only some websites via VPN and others directly.

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons  share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances  pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

closes #167524

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: Getting rid of JS rules, used to set a cookie

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We have ~317 JS rules, used to set a cookie. They can be found by:
`document.cookie =`
They must be replaced by `set-cookie` / `set-cookie-reload` / `trusted-set-cookie-reload` scriptlet rules.

There are many old rules, so first you need to check if the site is available, and then the need for the rule.

* For convenience, you can work in a separate browser
* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

issue.title: Getting rid of JS rules, used to set a cookie

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We have ~317 JS rules, used to set a cookie. They can be found by:
`document.cookie =`
They must be replaced by `set-cookie` / `set-cookie-reload` / `trusted-set-cookie-reload` scriptlet rules.

There are many old rules, so first you need to check if the site is available, and then the need for the rule.

* For convenience, you can work in a separate browser
* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

comment.body: @piquark6046 If it's not clear from the rule what it's for, and the site is still working - just convert to a scriptlet.

Block trackers, Hide your search queries, Send websites signals not to track you, Hide Referrer from third parties ### Issue Details Download buttons on softonic.com got disabled (load infinitely) when your filter "AdGuard Annoyances" (category Annoyances) is enabled - here is an example https://bookviser-reader-premium.de.softonic.com/ When turned off the filter the button is enabled. !!! When switch on/off the filter, you have to clear the cookies for that domain and reload the site after that to make the change take effect. ### Expected Behavior download buttons should not become disabled by your filter "AdGuard Annoyances" ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://github.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com) ### Comment > I have been receiving this error for many domains for the last few weeks or so: > > Safari can't open this page because the server can't be found. > > This issue seems to involve domains without the www in front. I have noticed it on many redirect links such as https://twitter.com/*, https://reddit.com*, https://github.com/*, and others, all without the www. Links to these sites work fine with Adguard enabled if they contain the www prefix. All other sites with www work as expected with AdGuard enabled. > > I have seen discussion online that there have been significant changes to iOS 17.1.1 Safari, as well as AdGuard Pro iOS 4.5.1 (as a response to bugs from iOS 17 changes), so I am thinking it has something to do with this. > > Thank you Username: `@azuryst` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
@Alex-302 Yes, it appears to be fixed-- the issue seemed to have been caused by the Adguard Cookie Notices filter v2.0.28.64 under DNS filters, which I added a long time ago with no issues, so not sure if the recent iOS 17 updates or the filter list updates broke it. I've now turned the list off under DNS filters and the mentioned sites all work again as expected :).

Thanks very much!
